definition: capacity/quantity/amount/to estimate/abbr. for 量詞|量词[liang4 ci2], classifier (in Chinese grammar)/measure word

son/child/seed/egg/small thing/1st earthly branch: 11 p.m.-1 a.m., midnight, 11th solar month (7th December to 5th January), year of the Rat/Viscount, fourth of five orders of nobility 五等爵位[wu3 deng3 jue2 wei4]/ancient Chinese compass point: 0° (north)
abbr. for 論語|论语[Lun2 yu3], The Analects (of Confucius)
opinion/view/theory/doctrine/to discuss/to talk about/to regard/to consider/per/by the (kilometer, hour etc)

sentences.english: Quantum theory is a branch of physics that deals with very small particles.
sentences.chinese: 量子論是一門研究微粒子的物理學。

sentences.english: It is, but it is possible, at least according to quantum theory.
sentences.chinese: 是很怪，但不無可能，至少根據量子論就可以。

sentences.english: Eight months on, this quantity theory of foreign policy faces a test.
sentences.chinese: 八個月過去了，這種外交政策上的量子論面臨考驗。

sentences.english: The idea that drives quantum theory comes from experiments with light.
sentences.chinese: 發展量子論的概念來自光的實驗。
